example.text: Big Tech Oversight is Coming In just one month as Twitter CEO, Elon Musk has unveiled a massive attempt by Big Tech to censor the New York Post 's credible Hunter Biden laptop story. The recent release of internal Twitter emails is the latest evidence of the tech giant and its liberal allies doing anything possible to discredit and diminish Republicans' efforts to highlight extremely relevant truth and facts.

Passing Bipartisan Legislation Over 50 percent of prisoners become incarcerated again within three years of being released - a horrific trend in America that must end in order to reduce our soaring crime rates. This week, the House passed two bipartisan bills I introduced to reform criminal justice programs for incarcerated pregnant women and individuals reentering their communities.

That's why I introduced the One Stop Shop Community Reentry Program Act , which supports community-based reentry resources for previously incarcerated individuals who return to their communities. I'm proud to see the House pass these bills and hope the Senate acts swiftly to do the same.

Biden's Disastrous Prisoner Swap This week, the Biden Administration announced a prison swap with Russia for WNBA player Brittney Griner that excluded Pittsburgh teacher Marc Fogel and Marine veteran Paul Whelan. Let's be clear: swapping a celebrity basketball player for the Merchant of Death - while excluding a Marine and a history teacher - is patently offensive and exposes this administration's deeply rooted disdain for everyday Americans.

Congress must investigate the negotiation process that brought Griner home but left Fogel and former Marine Paul Whelan in Russia. Electing to trade only a celebrity basketball player for a notorious Russian international arms dealer - while Fogel and Whelan remain in Russia - warrants heavy scrutiny.

That's why I introduced the One Stop Shop Community Reentry Program Act , which supports community-based reentry resources for previously incarcerated individuals who return to their communities. I'm proud to see the House pass these bills and hope the Senate acts swiftly to do the same.
